title: Kennedy Center Board Moves to Rename It the Trump-Kennedy Center
summary: The board for the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts announced that it would now be named the Trump-Kennedy Center, although a formal change may have to be approved by Congress.

title: Once Again, Health Care Proves to Be a Bitter Political Pill for G.O.P.
summary: The inability to find a credible counter to the Affordable Care Act has long bedeviled Republicans and cost them at the polls. It’s threatening to do so again next year.

title: Trump Moves to End Gender-Related Care for Minors, Threatening Hospitals That Offer It
summary: Proposed new rules would punish the hospitals by pulling all federal financing. Advocates say lawsuits will follow.

title: ‘Don’s Best Friend’: How Epstein and Trump Bonded Over the Pursuit of Women
summary: The president has tried to minimize their friendship, but documents and interviews reveal an intense and complicated relationship. Chasing women was a game of ego and dominance. Female bodies were currency.

title: The Junior Congressman Who’s Pushing Republicans on Epstein
summary: The top Democrat on the Oversight Committee, Representative Robert Garcia has brought aggressive tactics and reality-show flair to investigating Jeffrey Epstein’s ties to President Trump.

title: Rob Reiner Family Tragedy Strikes a Nerve for Families Fighting Addiction
summary: Nick Reiner, charged with murdering his parents, Rob and Michele Singer Reiner, spent much of his life battling drug addiction, an affliction that millions of Americans face.

title: After Rob Reiner’s ‘North’ Flopped, He Proved He Could Take Criticism With Humor
summary: Roger Ebert said he “hated, hated, hated, hated, hated” Reiner’s 1994 film “North.” The director took it in stride.

title: TikTok Signs Agreements With Investors in Step Toward Avoiding a U.S. Ban
summary: The Chinese-owned video app formalized commitments from the software giant Oracle and two investment firms as part of a deal to keep TikTok operating in the United States.

title: Trump Media to Merge With TAE Technologies, a Nuclear Fusion Firm, in a $6 Billion Deal
summary: Trump Media & Technology Group, the social media and crypto company part owned by President Trump, said it would help develop a “utility-scale fusion power plant.”

title: The Woman in the Coldplay Concert Kiss Cam Video Is Ready to Talk
summary: Kristin Cabot was caught on camera with her boss at a concert. The video went viral. Soon she was drowning in the vitriol of strangers.

title: Mamdani Appointee Resigns After Decade-Old Antisemitic Posts Re-emerge
summary: Catherine Almonte Da Costa resigned from her just-announced post as Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani’s director of appointments after the Anti-Defamation League resurfaced the comments.

title: N.Y.C. Subway Crime Is Down, Hochul Says, Rebutting Trump Officials
summary: Gov. Kathy Hochul said the state would spend another $77 million on police patrols in the subway, acknowledging that felony assaults remain stubbornly high.

title: They Thought They Had ‘Made It.’ Now They Can’t Afford Food.
summary: New Yorkers in the so-called “missing middle,” who may make too much for food benefits, say it’s still hard to find enough money for groceries.

title: James Cameron Tempers His Temper and Channels His Inner Na’vi
summary: Years after his Titanic tantrums, the “Avatar” director has “mellowed,” says Sigourney Weaver. He calls it “marinating.”

title: Confirm or Deny: James Cameron Edition
summary: The box office king sits for a lightning-round interview.

title: ‘Avatar: Fire and Ash’ Review: By Land, by Water, by Air!
summary: For the franchise’s third movie, James Cameron throws in new creatures, new landscapes, melodramatic plot lines and big battle sequences. It’s a lot.

title: The D.N.C. Is Scrapping Its Report on What Went Wrong in 2024
summary: Ken Martin, the Democratic National Committee chairman, ordered the autopsy months ago but is now said to believe that its release would be counterproductive for the party.

title: Trump Relies on Distortions to Support His Pressure Campaign on Venezuela
summary: The president has a long record of making false or misleading statements. But the sheer density of them in his administration’s boat attacks and Venezuela pressure campaign is exceptional.

title: Palo Alto Confronts Billionaires Over Their Housing Compounds
summary: The Silicon Valley college town has changed drastically as Mark Zuckerberg, Larry Page and other tech founders have scooped up multiple properties.

title: Cardinal Timothy Dolan Tapped the Power of the New York Pulpit
summary: From St. Patrick’s Cathedral to the White House to Fox News, he comfortably inhabited many spheres of influence.

title: Pope Leo Appoints Bishop Ronald Hicks to Succeed Timothy Dolan
summary: The appointment of Bishop Ronald A. Hicks is expected to bring a markedly different leadership style to New York’s archdiocese.

title: James B. Hunt Jr., North Carolina Governor Who Kept State Blue, Dies at 88
summary: During his 16 years in office, he earned national acclaim for his focus on education. But losing his bid for the Senate in 1984 cost him a shot at the presidency.

title: Obama Supported It. The Left in Canada and Norway Do. Why Don’t Democrats?
summary: Liberals should reconcile with America’s oil and gas industry.

title: Justin Trudeau and Katy Perry Are Worth Rooting For
summary: As a politician, Justin Trudeau was an excellent celebrity. And the rest of the world could learn a useful lesson from how he wielded his star power.

title: The U.S. Moves to End Gender-Related Care for Minors
summary: Also, authorities search for a person of interest in the Brown shooting. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.

title: Zelensky Appeals to E.U. Leaders for Frozen Russian Funds to Fight War
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky said in Brussels, where the leaders had gathered, that without the money, his country would have to reduce its drone production significantly.

title: Wyoming Cowboys Are Breaking Down Barriers, Literally
summary: GPS collars on cattle are letting ranchers remove fences in the West. That’s good for wildlife and for the land.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene, Donald Trump Jr. and More Conservative Figures Announce Their Engagements
summary: Several prominent conservative figures have announced that they are engaged this week, news often celebrated by President Trump.

title: Jelly Roll Is Pardoned for Previous Robbery and Drug Convictions
summary: The clemency decision by Gov. Bill Lee of Tennessee could make it easier for the country star to travel internationally.
